title: Casa Transports awards Alstom €100m contract for 50 Citadis tramsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Casa Transports awards Alstom €100m contract for 50 Citadis trams  
Casa Transports, the public company in charge of public transport in Casablanca, Morocco, has awarded Alstom a €100m contract to supply 50 Citadis low-floor trams for the city’s second light rail line, reported International Railway Journal on October 13.
The 32m-long vehicles will operate in double units, accommodating up to 606 passengers per pair. The trams will have low floors and 12 side doors, enabling access for all, including those with reduced mobility.
The design, intended to be sympathetic to the city’s architecture, will be similar to that of the 74 Citadis trams already supplied by Alstom for the 31km tramway Line 1. Since opening in December 2012 ridership on Line 1 has increased by more than 30%, necessitating a second line.
The 22.5km Line 2 will link Ain Sebaa in the east with the city’s main hospital in the central district of Hermitage, running via El Badr, Laayoune, and Mers Sultan and interchanging with Line 1 at Abdelmoumen and Ibn Tachfine stations. Preparatory construction of Line 2, including utilities diversion works, began in May this year and major construction is scheduled to start next May. The new line is set to open in late 2018.
Assembly of the trams will take place at Alstom’s La Rochelle plant in France and deliveries will start in July 2017. The order will be 65%-financed by the French Government and 35% by the Moroccan Government.
Youssef Draiss, Managing Director of Casa Transports, will be attending International Railway Summit 2016. Mr Draiss will take part in one-to-one consultation meetings with participating solution providers throughout the summit.
 
Source:- Alstom
